citation.article-title: Rhodoferax antarcticus sp. nov., a moderately psychrophilic purple nonsulfur bacterium isolated from an Antarctic microbial mat.

p.s: Description of Rhodoferax antarcticus sp. nov.
Cells curved rods to spirilla, 0.7x2–3 μm and highly motile.
Bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids present but no discernible intracytoplasmic membranes.
Mass cultures of phototrophically grown cells are peachcolored.
Growth occurs phototrophically (anaerobically) both photoheterotrophically on a variety of organic and fatty acids or on glucose, and photoautotrophically (H2+CO2).
Biotin required as a growth factor but yeast extract growth stimulatory.
NaCl not required and growth inhibitory above 2%.
Phylogeny: a member of the b-Proteobacteria.
Type strain, ANT.BRT, isolated from a microbial mat near Cape Royds, Ross Island (77°S), Antarctica.
Deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 700587.
Ribosomal RNA gene sequence accessioned in GenBank as AF084947.
